{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3408892,"name":"","username":"Clodsire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clodsire/{size}/266066_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-16T23:43:15.099Z","cooked":"

I’ve looked into purchasing a drone for getting aerial pictures of outreach. However, drone photography for any commercial use requires a drone pilot license. Would that include judging packets? Out team is a community based team ran by a non-profit organization (non profits are considered a commercial use for legal purposes).

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-16T23:43:15.099Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":132,"reads":477,"readers_count":476,"score":770.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":468761,"topic_slug":"is-first-legally-commercial-work","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66542,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Some people call me the Space Cowboy"},"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/is-first-legally-commercial-work/468761/1","custom_user_title":"Some people call me the Space Cowboy","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3408894,"name":"Andrew Koch","username":"Ankoch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ankoch/{size}/189928_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-16T23:59:21.943Z","cooked":"

Technically, according to the FAA, taking photos at an outreach event would likely fall under Part 107. That means it is commercial work. The FAA has the below guidance.

Non-recreational drone flying include things like taking photos to help sell a property or service, roof inspections, or taking pictures of a high school football game for the school’s website. Goodwill can also be considered non-recreational. This would include things like volunteering to use your drone to survey coastlines on behalf of a non-profit organization.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-16T23:59:21.943Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":451,"readers_count":450,"score":105.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":468761,"topic_slug":"is-first-legally-commercial-work","display_username":"Andrew Koch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.faa.gov/uas/recreational_flyers","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38528,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"836 Media Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-first-legally-commercial-work/468761/2","custom_user_title":"836 Media Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3408896,"name":"","username":"dcnemesis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dcnemesis/{size}/259511_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T00:00:16.524Z","cooked":"

Looking at the regulations, probably yes. It isn’t really whether it is “commercial” work, they use the term for anything non-recreational (anything just for fun, hobby). The website includes filming a high school football game for the website as an example non-recreational use. See: Recreational Flyers & Community-Based Organizations | Federal Aviation Administration (faa.gov)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T00:00:16.524Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":419,"readers_count":418,"score":93.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468761,"topic_slug":"is-first-legally-commercial-work","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.faa.gov/uas/recreational_flyers","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - 4967 (former mentor 2405) "},"post_url":"/t/is-first-legally-commercial-work/468761/3","custom_user_title":"Mentor - 4967 (former mentor 2405) ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3408901,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T00:08:14.030Z","cooked":"

If you notice it says “can be” under goodwill. As long as it’s for community outreach (Which I would put under goodwill). So this topic is actually pretty interesting. After looking through a bit of case law, most courts lay out a 2 test process to determine if it is a commercial entity.

First, What purpose does the work include and does it serve the greater public.

Secondly, is the organization private or public and does it compete or replace local commercial businesses.

Under these 2 tests, my interpretation is that no, taking pictures for community public robotics team is not for commercial use.

Disclaimer I am not a lawyer and it’s probably better safe than sorry to get a license

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T04:16:49.301Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":373,"readers_count":372,"score":79.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":468761,"topic_slug":"is-first-legally-commercial-work","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38528,"username":"Ankoch","name":"Andrew Koch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ankoch/{size}/189928_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/is-first-legally-commercial-work/468761/4","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3408906,"name":"Andy Galicki","username":"aagalicki","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/e9c0ed/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T00:28:12.232Z","cooked":"

Part 107 pilot here!

Yes, more likely than not flying for FRC related things would be considered “in furtherance of a business” and you might be better off acquiring your Part 107.

On the OTHER hand, it really isn’t all that bad, and I highly recommend taking one of the available online courses to help you study for the test. Some of them even will even offer to pay for the test again should you fail it.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T00:28:12.232Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":309,"readers_count":308,"score":106.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468761,"topic_slug":"is-first-legally-commercial-work","display_username":"Andy Galicki","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Mentor/Media/Scouting | FRC 6081 & FTC 11193"},"post_url":"/t/is-first-legally-commercial-work/468761/5","custom_user_title":"Lead Mentor/Media/Scouting | FRC 6081 & FTC 11193","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3408937,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T03:13:40.107Z","cooked":"
aagalicki:

On the OTHER hand, it really isn’t all that bad

Here are the requirements and the process: https://www.faa.gov/uas/commercial_operators/become_a_drone_pilot#ftp

the test is $175 per attempt and depending on where you live may be a bit of a distance away (my nearest testing center is ~50 miles away)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T03:13:40.107Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":38.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468761,"topic_slug":"is-first-legally-commercial-work","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.faa.gov/uas/commercial_operators/become_a_drone_pilot#ftp","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/is-first-legally-commercial-work/468761/6","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3408948,"name":"Andrew Koch","username":"Ankoch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ankoch/{size}/189928_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T04:13:18.393Z","cooked":"

I would err on the side of caution and interpret that taking photos of robotics (often touted as a sport) is more analogous to the provided example of taking photos of a high school sporting event than the nonproft example. However, I agree that you could probably make the case for goodwill. Especially if the robotics team is associated with an established nonprofit rather than a school.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-07-17T04:13:18.393Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":34.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468761,"topic_slug":"is-first-legally-commercial-work","display_username":"Andrew Koch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33848,"username":"jedgar6","name":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38528,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"836 Media Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-first-legally-commercial-work/468761/7","custom_user_title":"836 Media Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3408951,"name":"James Austin","username":"James1902","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/james1902/{size}/65505_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-17T04:25:39.291Z","cooked":"

Regardless of the definition of commercial use, if you’re flying drones at events with large groups of people (I assume that is usually where outreaches worth filming are happening) the event organizers, local governments, or other organizations would likely require some sort of permission structure to fly at the event, and that’d usually include having a part 107 licensed pilot in command of the drone anyway.

Don’t wanna dissuade you from getting a drone (they’re a ton of fun!) but honestly these days i’d recommend most folks get their 107 if they plan on doing anything beyond flying in remote locations far away for people.
